data.shownotes:
This show featured the live debut of Magma. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. The Garden Goblin was introduced by Cookie as a song that he wrote about his dog. Leah Senior was shouted out after Magma. Rattlesnake contained Doom City, O.N.E., Honey, Nuclear Fusion, Billabong Valley, & Automation teases and quotes and Sleep Drifter teases.

Poster Art by Jason Galea
130 Standard / 30 Foil Print

This show featured the live debut of A New World. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Flamethrower teases, as well as Iron Lung quotes. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress played over the music to The Grim Reaper followed by Sadie Sorceress quotes and teases. Ice V contained Slow Jam 1 quotes. A New World through Altered Beast II featured narration by Leah Senior. Altered Beast I was played for the first time since 2022-10-05 (90 show gap). Alter Me I and Altered Beast II were played for the first time since 2019-10-06 (87 show gap). Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Leah Senior was shouted out after Magma. The Dripping Tap contained Hypertension quotes and Hell’s Itch and Head On/Pill teases.

Poster by Jason Galea
320 Standard / 40 Foil Print

Sleep Drifter contained Honey quotes and teases and O.N.E., Billabong Valley, and Rattlesnake teases. Ambrose quoted “Fuck tha Police” (N.W.A) in Billabong Valley. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. Leah Senior was shouted out before Magma. Poster by Jason Galea 220 Standard / 30 Foil
This was an in-studio appearance for radio station KEXP in Seattle. Following Magma the band had a 10 minute interview with KEXP DJ/on-air events coordinator Cheryl Waters.

An I In Heaven? was teased prior to Magenta Mountain. The intro to O.N.E. contained Straws in the Wind teases. The River contained Wah Wah teases and quotes throughout, as well as Crumbling Castle teases. The Land Before Timeland was played over the PA as the setbreak music, which incidentally served as the “debut” for the studio track. Rattlesnake contained teases and quotes from O.N.E., Automation, Honey, and Minimum Brain Size, and teases of Sleep Drifter. Honey contained teases of Sleep Drifter and Billabong Valley. The Reticent Raconteur through The Balrog featured Leah Senior (introduced as “The Balrog” and “the best singer”) providing the narration. Ambrose quoted “Happy Birthday, Lisa” (The Simpsons) while referencing Joey’s “Australian birthday” prior to The Grim Reaper. The Grim Reaper was then introduced as “some weird-ass Satanic rap”. Venusian 2 and Am I in Heaven? were on the printed setlist but were replaced with Planet B due to time constraints. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea This is the first edition of this print
Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Ambrose quoted “Evergreen” (Leah Senior) before The Dripping Tap. Poster By Jason Galea 230 Standard / 30 Foil

The start of the show was delayed by 4-5 minutes due to issues with Stu’s guitar/equipment. There was much humorous banter from the band during the delay. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. The segue from O.N.E. to Sleep Drifter contained a Honey tease. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Only Parts I, II, and III of The River were performed and they contained an Am I In Heaven? tease and a Wah Wah tease. The River [Part III] was reprised during Wah Wah, which also contained a quote of The River. Poster By Carlo Vivary

The show opened with a brief drum solo by Cavs prior to the rest of the band taking the stage. History owner (Drake) (“Champagne Papi”) was mentioned a number of times over the course of the show. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. and Automation quotes and teases. Ambrose crowd surfed while singing the refrain in Straws in the Wind. Joey introduced Anoxia as “my Neil Young impersonation song.” Ice V was introduced as being “in memory of Queen E.” Prior to Digital Black, Joey said "hello" numerous times in a Han-Tyumi impression. Soy-Protein Munt Machine and Vomit Coffin contained Hypertension teases. The Dripping Tap contained an I’m in Your Mind Fuzz Suite tease. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The recordings of this show are incomplete (missing Digital Black). KGLW.net staff do have enough to confirm the > into Han-Tyumi and that Ice V came to a full stop. For the show opening drum solo, it was discussed whether this should be added to the setlist as “Fury” in order to match with the show opening drum solo from the Melbourne ‘21 bootlegger release. It was decided that the drum solos labeled “Fury” by the band consist of a distinct double bass drum part which is absent from this drum solo and that other drum solos have been given different names (i.e. “Parking” on Chunky Shrapnel), therefore it was decided to leave this drum solo as a show note since we do not have definitive information on what it should be called. If anyone has any further information about these items, or ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Honey contained Sleep Drifter and Rattlesnake teases. The Sleep Drifter outro -> to O.N.E. contained Billabong Valley teases. Leah Senior and Black Midi were shouted out after O.N.E. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band, which also contained People-Vultures teases. After the solo, Joey lamented that they didn’t have another drum set to hold a drum battle between Cavs and Morgan of Black Midi. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases.

Posters By Jason Galea
Show: 555 Standard / 55 Foil Print
Record Fair: 100 Standard Print
data.soundcheck: Magenta Mountain w/ attempted > The Grim Reaper

data.shownotes:
The show began with a drum solo leading into Venusian 2. Before Predator X, an “Asheville Gatherum” shirt was thrown on stage, and Stu changed into it. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Magenta Mountain teases. Magenta Mountain was dedicated to Robert “Bob” Moog, inventor of the Moog synthesizer. Nuclear Fusion featured Lucas on the intro vocal. Another t-shirt was thrown up on stage after Iron Lung; Stu thanked everyone for the t-shirts noting that “I fucking stink like shit so it’s perfect.” After Stu declared that “showers are for squares,” Ambrose then suggested that Stu had never had a shower in his life, “only golden ones.” Wah Wah contained a The River intro, as well as teases and quotes. The Dripping Tap contained The Land Before Timeland teases.

Poster By Lewy Jones

data.footnote: Intro jam as Stu reads birthday cards
data.shownotes: It was announced prior to the show that Stu was late to the stage because he had “diarrhea or something”. Stu then entered the stage costumed as “Disco Stu” and noted that it was his birthday show. After Hell, Stu teased "Stayin' Alive" (Bee Gees). Persistence was stopped partway through for a cake “being fucked by a sexy alien” to be presented to Stu, and for the crowd and band to sing “Happy Birthday to You” to Stu, after which Stu passed out the cake to the audience and several jokes were made about the cake's contents. Persistence was finished after the mid-song break. The River contained Wah Wah teases and an Ice V tease. Leah Senior was shouted out before Lava. At the end of the show, Stu was hit with silly string by the band while the audience sang to him again. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Fans of stage banter will want to listen to this show for humorous birthday comments throughout the show, and other amusing banter about being drunk and the Satanic nuns that often appear at their shows. Poster By Josh Freydkis

Hot Wax was announced as a dedication to Joe Santarpia, one of the band's sound engineers. Hot Wax was played for the first time since 2022-04-28 (50 show gap). I’m Not in Your Mind contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Cellophane contained Am I in Heaven? teases and Hot Wax quotes. Ambergris was introduced as a song about “the most expensive ingredient in modern humanity.” Iron Lung featured an extended Red Hot Chili Peppers style intro while Lucas was using the restroom, followed by additional mid-song banter about Lucas. A New World through Altered Beast II featured Leah Senior providing the narration.

The band introduced the show by acknowledging how little they play hometown shows, citing Melbourne inner-city gentrification. Crumbling Castle was then introduced as “The Fourth Colour”, “Crumbling Castle”, and finally, “Gamma Knife”. The Fourth Colour featured a Cavs drum solo. The Grim Reaper was introduced as a song that Ambrose wrote about Stu, and featured an additional verse and quotes from Sadie Sorceress. Stu sang the third verse twice instead of the second verse in Ice V. Iron Lung was introduced as a “song about vaping”. Ambergris was introduced as a song about “the most expensive naturally occurring ingredient”. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam.

This show was part of the 2022 Rhythm & Alps Festival. “The End” (The Doors) was briefly quoted after The Fourth Colour. Am I In Heaven? contained Witchcraft, Head On/Pill and The Dripping Tap teases. Amusing banter followed Am I in Heaven? where the band talked about their New Year’s resolutions. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo, during which Stu and Joey sprayed the crowd with champagne, followed by a full band “Moby Dick” (Led Zeppelin) tease. Boogieman Sam contained “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes. Some other artists appearing at this festival were specifically shouted out by Joey: Marlon Williams, Sampa the Great, and Dope Lemon.

This show was originally scheduled to be at Bowl of Brooklands, but was moved indoors to TSB Stadium due to weather. I’m Not in Your Mind contained The Dripping Tap teases and Alter Me teases and quotes. The River contained Happy Birthday to You quotes and eventually came to a full stop as Sam’s birthday was recognized by the band and crowd. Ice V subsequently contained The River teases. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained teases from the I’m In Your Mind Fuzz Suite before reprising Cellophane.
People-Vultures contained a “Down With the Sickness” (Disturbed) quote. Mr. Beat contained The Dripping Tap teases. Automation was dedicated to ChatGPT. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases. Her & I (Slow Jam 2) contained Iron Lung quotes and teases. This Thing was played for the first time since Feb. 21, 2020 (94 show gap) and contained The Dripping Tap quotes. Before Magenta Mountain, Stu announced that he was a “dickhead." Joey subsequently changed the lyrics of Magenta Mountain to “I don’t believe Stu”. Robot Stop contained Hot Water and Her & I (Slow Jam 2) teases. During Hot Water Stu took over drums & Cavs crowd surfed. Shanghai, Trapdoor and Evil Death Roll were on the printed setlist but were not played. Poster By Drew Millward

Rattlesnake contained Automation teases and quotes. Ambrose quoted O.N.E. prior to Straws in the Wind. This Thing was introduced as a song about “being a piece of shit”. The jam out of Shanghai featured the first Grow Wings And Fly lyrics from Stu: “Let’s get real high and eat apple pie.” Evil Death Roll contained Shanghai, Mars for the Rich, and Hypertension teases. KGLW.Net Staff Notes: This may be the first time the voice of Han-Tyumi was run by Jason Galea offstage. Additional Han-Tyumi narration not previously played live may have been added to this version. Upon full review of all prior MoTU suites, additional notes may be added to describe first time or ongoing use of Han-Tyumi narration. Poster By Josh Freydkis 100 Standard/ 20 Foil / 30 AP

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases/quotes. Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly 'Lets Get Real High' jam. Work This Time contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote and featured a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. The River contained Iron Lung teases. Trapdoor was listed on the printed setlist after Muddy Water but was not played. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Evil Death Roll was introduced as a song about crocodiles and contained The Dripping Tap and Trapdoor teases.  Alter Me I contained Ice V teases.  Billabong Valley and Honey contained Sleep Drifter teases.  Ambrose quoted Polygondwanaland before Inner Cell. The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and an extra verse from Sadie Sorceress.  Los Bitchos joined the band for Trapdoor, which contained a percussion solo.

Poster by Lewy Jones

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases/quotes and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and The Dripping Tap teases/quotes. Hot Water contained The Dripping Tap teases and had lyrics changed to "time to party". The segue from Gamma Knife to Hypertension consisted of a full band outro of People-Vultures. Work This Time contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly jam. Amby shouted out Tame Impala after Shanghai. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress and contained Horology teases. The Dripping Tap contained Am I in Heaven? teases, Cellophane teases, Head On/Pill teases, and a jam reminiscent of Mycelium.

This show was part of the 2023 Vintage Vibes Festival. Ice V contained Iron Lung quotes. Gaia contained a drum solo from Cavs. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. Magenta Mountain was introduced as being about “mountains and stuff” and had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu.” KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show has been confirmed, but only partial recordings exist. The full setlist was confirmed via the available recordings and written setlist for this show as well as contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations for missing or incomplete songs that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Amy Jean 100 Standard / 20 Foil

This show featured the debut of Witchcraft. This was “Drag Night”, in which the full band wore dresses and makeup in celebration of Tennessee’s “Adult Entertainment Act” (AKA anti-drag show law) being found unconstitutional by a federal judge. Rattlesnake contained Minimum Brain Size teases and was followed by a quote of “Signed, Sealed, Delivered (I’m Yours)” (Stevie Wonder) by Amby. Straws In The Wind contained a Swan Song quote. Gaia contained Motor Spirit quotes and teases. Boogieman Sam contained quotes of “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole). Following Magma, Joey announced that he and Cookie had been working on their flatpicking to play bluegrass and jokingly asked where Billy Strings was. Lava contained an “Unknown Legend” (Neil Young) tease. Head On/Pill contained Hot Water teases and Am I In Heaven? teases. Evil Death Roll was on the printed setlist but was not played. Poster By Jason Galea 560 Standard/ 150 Foil Print

data.jamchart_notes: On-point vocals and Cavs drumming like a man possessed lead into a heavy and powerful finish to the closer of the early set.
data.shownotes: The Dripping Tap was dedicated to Cavs’ father, Bill, “the best plumber in the world.” Satan Speeds Up was played for the first time known since November 15, 2014 (539 show gap), and contained a “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Shanghai featured the “let’s get real high” jam from Grow Wings and Fly. This Thing contained “Incredible” (M Beat) quotes. Most of What I Like was played fully electric for the first time. Previous performances were done acoustically and partially acoustic. See Most of What I Like. The Wheel and Evil Death Roll were switched on the physical setlist, but were swapped because "Amby wants to keep chilling". Evil Death Roll contained Iron Lung quotes. Following the show those attending both the early and late shows were allowed to stay in the venue and the band's new album PetroDragonic Apocalypse was played over the PA. KGLW.net Staff Notes: While it was widely believed that Satan Speeds Up had never been played live prior to this show; per Stu's comments a previously unnoted performance took place at the 2014 St. Kilda Festival (February 9, 2014). As there are no known recordings of the band's set at the 2014 St. Kilda Festival, if anyone has any information on what was played at the 2014 St. Kilda Festival show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea 2000 Standard / 500 Foil

An audience member named Seb was brought onstage to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion, which contained a Hell's Itch tease. Joey shouted out Dead & Co. after Minimum Brain Size. Gaia was dedicated to John Mayer ("the guitar slayer"). The River contained a Wah Wah tease. Boogieman Sam contained “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), “Sweet Home Chicago” (Robert Johnson), “My Babe” (Little Walter), Cut Throat Boogie, and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, “On the Road Again” (Canned Heat), Le Risque, and Head On/Pill teases, and The Dripping Tap teases/quotes. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live in Chicago '23. Poster By Jason Galea 460 Standard / 130 Foil

This was a three-hour marathon show and the first marathon show to be performed as a single set. The show opened with a video of Amby's father, Broderick Smith, introducing the band. Eyes Like the Sky through Evil Man was dedicated to Broderick Smith and featured Broderick’s narration from the Eyes Like the Sky album played over the PA while the band played, and photos of Broderick displayed on the large screen behind the band. Eyes Like the Sky, Year Of Our Lord, and The Raid were played for the first time since December 1, 2018 (192 show gap). Evil Man was played for the first time since February 18, 2016 (449 show gap). Prior to Gaia, Joey quoted “I Love L.A.” (Randy Newman). The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. During the drum solo by Cavs following Astroturf the rest of the band left the stage, then returned and performed a metal vamp over the end of the solo. Shanghai featured the Grow Wings and Fly “let’s get real high” jam. Ambergris featured an extended intro during which Joey and Amby contemplated the nature of sexiness. The Dripping Tap was dedicated by Amby to Cavs’ dad and to his “first music teacher who said my voice sounds weird,” and contained Cellophane teases and Hot Water teases.

Joey shouted-out other performers at the festival: Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Sam Fender, Flume, Little Simz, and Marlon Williams. Joey acknowledged that the performance was taking place on stolen land, that the band will be voting yes in the upcoming Indigenous voice to Parliament referendum, and that the audience should do the same. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Special shout out to our very own @W.B.T.G. Slinger for the recording located on Archive.org and YouTube!

Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained alternate lyrics and a Dragon jam. Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer contained an Ice V jam with lyrics. The River contained Ice V teases. Sleep Drifter contained Rattlesnake teases, Am I In Heaven? teases, and Billabong Valley quotes/teases. The vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion was done by an audience member named Lars who was brought on stage. Cavs teased Metallica’s One when Lars introduced himself. Straws In The Wind was humorously dedicated to everyone under 3 years old, as Joey had spotted multiple babies in the crowd and contained Extinction quotes.  Gaia contained a drum solo by Cavs.

This show featured the debut of Dragon. Am I In Heaven? contained teases of Hot Water and Witchcraft.

Poster By Elora Sperber

data.jamchart_notes: Oscar Karls of Viagra Boys on saxophone.
data.shownotes: Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs. This Thing was introduced as a song by Jimi Hendrix called "Hey James" and contained slightly alternate lyrics and The Dripping Tap teases & quotes. Hypertension was dedicated to Partiboi69. Magma was dedicated to John Butler. Hypertension and Magma featured Oscar Carls of Viagra Boys on saxophone. Wah Wah and Road Train were on the printed setlist but were not played.

This show featured the debut of Kepler-22b. Gamma Knife contained a People-Vultures tease. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Magenta Mountain, Kepler-22b, Straws In the Wind, Magma, Gamma Knife, Iron Lung, and Han-Tyumi through Murder of the Universe have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist for the show and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jessica Rassi 130 Printed

Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases.  Hypertension contained Evil Death Roll teases.  Ice V contained Presumptuous and Her and I teases.  Hot Water contained The Dripping Tap quotes and teases.  This Thing contained Hot Water quotes.

Poster By Max Löffler
data.venuename: Plaza Mayor de El Poble Espanyol

data.shownotes: The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber and "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. Evil Death Roll contained Converge teases. Rattlesnake contained Boogieman Sam quotes and Flamethrower teases. K.G.L.W. (Outro) was on the printed setlist after Rattlesnake but was not played. Poster by Drew Millward

Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Evil Death Roll contained Iron Lung quotes. Cut Throat Boogie contained “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) and “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes and Le Risque teases. The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases.

This show featured the debut of Flamethrower. Joey commented after, that they would do the last half of the song next time. Am I In Heaven? contained Sad Pilot, Flamethrower, and Cut Throat Boogie teases, a Witchcraft tease, and Iron Lung teases and quotes. Following Flamethrower, Joey shouted out opener Grace Cummings. This Thing contained La Grange (ZZ Top) teases and lyrics parodying the song. Iron Lung contained a Hypertension tease. Hypertension contained Witchcraft, Magma, and Ice V teases. Work This Time contained Ice V teases from Cavs. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. The written setlist had Doom City and Minimum Brain Size before Float Along - Fill Your Lungs but they were cut for time. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

This show featured a new synth table setup and the debuts of Extinction and Gondii. Grace Cummings unfortunately missed a second show due to illness, and was replaced with local Berlin artist Cosey Mueller. Extinction contained a Gondii tease and Flamethrower quotes. Gondii contained Extinction teases and quotes. The Dripping Tap contained Sad Pilot teases, Motor Spirit quotes, and a Witchcraft tease. Only Parts I, II, and III of The River were performed and they contained a Motor Spirit tease, Wah Wah teases and quotes, and Extinction teases. Wah Wah contained The River teases and Extinction teases and quotes. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Before Gila Monster, the band thanks crew members Nico and Laura for building the new synth table setup at which point Cookie teases Happy Birthday. Gila Monster contained a Dragon tease. All Is Known and Rattlesnake were on the physical setlist (before and after Doom City respectively), but were cut for time. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

Grace Cummings unfortunately missed a fifth show due to illness, and was replaced with Australian rock band C.O.F.F.I.N., who were joined by Ambrose during their opening set. The Lord of Lightning contained Cellophane and Witchcraft teases. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Am I In Heaven? teases and Daily Blues teases and quotes. The Bitter Boogie contained the drums from Muddy Water, Head On/Pill teases, Rats In The Sky, Hog Calling Contest, Antarctica, and Daily Blues quotes. Cellophane contained Rattlesnake teases. Ben Portnoy (drummer of C.O.F.F.I.N) joined the band for Rattlesnake, which contained Automation, Honey, Billabong Valley, and Minimum Brain Size teases, Honey teases and quotes with the lyrics changed to "Mad Dog tastes like honey", Daily Blues, Boogieman Sam, Oddlife, and Straws In The Wind quotes, and an Oddlife and Billabong Valley jam with lyrics. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 150

data.showtitle: Drag Night at Les Nuits De Fourviere
data.shownotes: The band dressed in drag for the 2nd ever drag night, exactly 1 year after the show on 2023-06-03. This show featured the debut of Theia. Theia contained Motor Spirit and Extinction quotes. Extinction contained The Grim Reaper teases. The Grim Reaper contained Get Low (Lil Jon & The East Side Boyz), Work It (Missy Elliot), Torture Chamber, and Body Movin' and Intergalactic (Beastie Boys) quotes. Following The Grim Reaper, Joey wished everyone a happy pride month. Gaia contained a drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. After Gaia, Joey shouted out Amy Taylor of Amyl and the Sniffers for doing his makeup pre-show. Ambrose sung a verse of Witchcraft for Stu due to Stu's pedal breaking. Cellophane contained Magma teases and quotes. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

data.jamchart_notes: A confident and ripping performance of Magma. Tight and creative jams that highlight the bands guitar work are matched with some of Ambrose’s more inspired saxophone playing. The end is taken to unusual lengths as the band cools the signature double time jam down before launching into the one of the heaviest outros Magma has ever seen.
data.shownotes:
This show featured the debut of Flight b741. Extinction contained The Grim Reaper quotes. The Grim Reaper contained a Gondii tease and Torture Chamber quotes. Perihelion featured an audience member named Timmy on Joey's guitar, and was dedicated to his friend Joey who sadly passed in an accident earlier in the year. Magma was dedicated by Joey to John Bonham and contained a You Can Be Your Silhouette tease. After Daily Blues, Joey shouted out Lucas. Wah Wah contained a The River intro and jam. Hypertension contained Ice V and Work This Time teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Motor Spirit and Dragon tease. Perihelion was not on the printed setlist, but Sea of Trees was (which was skipped).

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition of 600
Holographic Edition of 200

Before Magma, Joey thanked Geese for opening. Muddy Water contained the drums from The Bitter Boogie along with teases, and featured Ambrose on sax. Raw Feel contained a Sympathy For the Devil (The Rolling Stones) tease. Ice V featured Jimi Hendrix-style scat vocals from Joey. Joey introduced Le Risque as a song about taking risks. Before Superbug, Joey told Stu not to write another song like it because he wrote it and it (Covid) happened. Superbug was played for the first time since 2023-06-07 (59 show gap). Before Dragon, Killing in the Name (Rage Against the Machine) was teased. Dragon was not on the printed setlist but was played.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 500
Foil Edition - 150

data.jamchart_notes: Transitioned into from Sad Pilot with a Rats in the Sky intro, this Magma is a bit heavier and messier than its counterparts from summer ‘24. A standout performance from Cavs particularly as his drumming steers the band heavier and heavier. The outro is taken to its usual heights, but as it falls out the band changes key to E and transitions smoothly into Rats in the Sky.
data.shownotes:
Venusian 1 was last played 2023-03-11 (87 show gap). Witchcraft was swapped for Flamethrower because Stu had forgotten they played it the night before. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E., Automation, Minimum Brain Size, Sleep Drifter, Oddlife, and Honey teases, Am I In Heaven? vocal teases by Ambrose, and Boogieman Sam quotes. The intro to Gondii contained Shanghai quotes with some lyrics changed to “Bye Bye Chang’e” and the song itself contained Shanghai teases. Magma contained a Rats In The Sky intro. Sea of Trees contained a The Land Before Timeland tease, a You Can Be Your Sillouhette jam, and Daily Blues teases. Gamma Knife contained Motor Spirit teases and quote.

Poster by Amy Jean

data.jamchart_notes: A stylish intro kicks off a funkier than usual Magma. A tight first verse and jam give way to playful springy flourishes in the bridge. An energetic and powerful second jam that strays from the usual course of Magma follows, with creative guitar lines from Stu and Joey dominating before settling back into the verse. The outro is taken to a familiar double time intensity, but again, unique guitar work from Stu and Joey lend it a distinct character and sound.
data.shownotes: Rattlesnake contained Automation and Sleep Drifter teases, Boogieman Sam quotes and Nuclear Fusion teases. O.N.E. and Sleep Drifter featured Stu on microtonal acoustic guitar. Open Water contained a Chang’e tease. The Lord of Lightning contained an Ice V tease. The Balrog contained a Cellophane tease. Before Hog Calling Contest, Joey mentioned that the band saw Dom Dolla at The Gorge the night before. Joe then asked the crowd to pretend to call hogs, and then invited sound manager Joe Santarpia to do the same. Stu then picked up an Intrasport shirt from a fan and told them they weren't playing it at the show, but would next tour, followed be an Intrasport tease. Flight b741 contained a false start due to Amby playing in the wrong key. Ice V contained a Head On/Pill tease and a Down Under (Men At Work) tease on drums. Dirt through Let Me Mend The Past featured Joey on acoustic guitar. Dirt conained a “Taylor” (Jack Johnson) tease. Mirage City was introduced as Paradise City (Guns N' Roses) followed by a Welcome to the Jungle quote from Amby. During Let Me Mend The Past, Ambrose crowdsurfed on an inflatable boat. Following Le Risque, Joey shouted out Jackson Devereux and Allen Dobbins (the stream film crew). Gondii contained a Dragon quote. The Silver Cord contained Extinction quotes. Daily Blues was quoted before Venusian 1, which was stopped halfway through due to the barricade being broken. During the stop, Joey called his mom and Stu and Joey sung part of Vegemite acapella, which was "performed" for the first time since 2016-05-14. Gaia, which was incomplete, featured a drum solo with a Motor Spirit tease. The Great Chain of Being was incomplete. Gaia Outro was on the printed setlist after Motor Spirit, but was cut. Poster by Jason Galea Normal - 2500 Foil - 500

data.jamchart_notes: Acoustic. Riding a steady disco drumbeat throughout, opening with extended banter where the band lists off their crew. Unlike the heavy vibe of traditional Magmas, it flows into a lighter, psychedelic Silver Cord jam with lyrics.
data.shownotes: Chang'e contained Witchcraft quotes from the extended mix. Sense contained Witchcraft teases. Following Raw Feel, Cavs teased Hey Pachuco (Royal Crown Revue) from The Mask. Ambrose teased Flight b741 before Dirt. Following Dirt, Ambrose called Joey "Joe Dirt". Following Flight b741, Joey asked the crowd if anyone in the band had been to their 2022 show in San Diego (2022-04-11) and Stu asked if anyone had been to The Soda Bar (2016-05-18 and 2015-08-25), mentioning there was someone dressed in a panda suit there, who he then spotted in the crowd. Iron Lung contained Can't Stop (Red Hot Chili Peppers) and Witchcraft teases. Muddy Water contained The Bitter Boogie and The Castle In The Air teases. The Bitter Boogie contained the drums from Muddy Water as well as teases. After The Bitter Boogie, Joey teased Good Riddance (Green Day) and Every Morning (Sugar Ray) and asked Sammy to turn his mic through the PA, and Joey teased Every Morning and Good Riddance again. Ambrose then jokingly brought up Green Day’s infamous 2012 iHeartRadio incident (during which the band destroyed their instruments angrily after being told their set was being cut short) and multiple band members quoted Billie Joe Armstrong’s exclamations from the performance. God Is Calling Me Back Home had lyrics changed to "She's calling me back home" and featured Joey playing guitar with a beer bottle. Inbetween God Is Calling Me Back Home and Magma, Joey teased Tell Me Why (Neil Young). Magma was played for Sammy, featured an extended intro where the band shouted out their crew members, did not have the "rumble" verse, and contained a The Silver Cord jam with lyrics. After Magma, the band jokingly played a portion of Gaia acoustically. Theia contained Motor Spirit teases & quotes and The River teases. Only Part I of The River (which was introduced as a song about "when you wake up in the morning, and you smell something, in the kitchen, it’s not supposed to be there, and it smells real good, and you go eat it, and then you feel real good, then you feel real sick") was performed and it contained Motor Spirit teases, Theia teases, and a The Silver Cord vocal jam with Theia quotes. Honey and Pleura were on some of the written setlists following Horology but were replaced with Magma.
data.venuename: The Rady Shell at Jacobs Park

data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Interior People, which featured Joey on acoustic guitar. I’m In Your Mind and I'm Not In Your Mind contained Cellophane teases. During I’m Not In Your Mind, Joey shouted out a young fan on his parent’s shoulders. Cut Throat Boogie contained Sad Pilot, Daily Blues and Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases. Trapdoor contained a Forty Six and 2 (Tool) tease. Before Hog Calling Contest, Joey mentioned how Ambrose invented a skate move called "Chicken to the Barnyard" and how he played Skate. During the banter, Stu put on clothes thrown in from the crowd, Joey asked who was going to the Rave Matthews Band show on Wednesday and teased “Taylor” (Jack Johnson) at which point Stu introduced the song as being by Jack Johnson. The song itself featured Joey on acoustic guitar and a pig squeal by audio tech Joe “Santo” Santarpia. Field of Vision was introduced as a song about the audience and was dedicated to Jess Lewis. Raw Feel contained Robot Stop, Witchcraft, and Third Stone From The Sun (Jimi Hendrix) teases. After the song, Joey complimented the venue, calling it “forest Red Rocks.” Ambrose quoted Le Risque before The Dripping Tap, which was dedicated to Billy Cavanaugh and contained Daily Blues, Cellophane and Magma teases and Magma quotes. Lucas referenced Pleura at the end of the show.

Mirage City was introduced as a "country song," featured Stu on acoustic guitar and contained a jam with lyrics of I’ll Be Gone (Spectrum) and a Riff Raff (AC/DC) tease. Raw Feel also featured Stu on acoustic guitar. Ice V contained Hog Calling Contest teases. Ambrose quoted the "one million dollars" line from Austin Powers and "Scotty Doesn't Know" from EuroTrip in the intro to Magma. The Dripping Tap was introduced as being sponsored by Pepto Bismol and contained You Can Be Your Silhouette and Machine Gun (Jimi Hendrix) teases. Work This Time was on the written setlist after Raw Feel but was not played.

Mr. Beat contained People-Vultures and Magma teases. Dirt and Mirage City featured Joey on acoustic guitar. Mirage City had an alternate slower outro section. Amby quoted Tomorrow (Silverchair) prior to The Dripping Tap, which contained Theia teases and quotes. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.

Rattlesnake contained Nuclear Fusion, O.N.E. and Automation teases and Honey teases & quotes. Ice V contained Mirage City teases. Hog Calling Contest featured Joey on acoustic guitar. Following Set Amby quoted She'll Be Coming 'Round the Mountain (traditional).  Magenta Mountain contained The Grim Reaper quotes.

The Dripping Tap was unfinished. Rattlesnake contained Nuclear Fusion and Sleep Drifter teases. After Rattlesnake, Ambrose quoted an old Australian ad. Flamethrower featured a drum solo by Cavs. Extinction and Set featured the debut of the upgraded synth table (Nathan). Set contained Extinction quotes and Temporary Secretary (Paul McCartney) and The River teases. The River contained Thunderstruck (AC/DC) and Sad Pilot teases.

The band walkout music was H.O.O.D by Kneecap. Theia was performed in an alternate rock version for the first time and contained a The Land Before Timeland tease and Wah Wah teases. Wah Wah contained a The River intro, quote, and teases as well as a Crumbling Castle tease and Motor Spirit teases and quotes. Open Water featured a drum solo by Cavs. Oddlife, which was played for the first time since 2023-03-13 (114 show gap), was played for Cookie and introduced as his favorite Gizzard song. I'm Not In Your Mind contained a Theia (Extended) jam with lyrics and Cellophane teases and featured Ambrose on sax. After Gila Monster, Joey said Free Palestine.
data.venuename: Plaza Mayor de El Poble Espanyol

data.shownotes: Altered Beast I was played for the first time since 2023-06-16 (96 shows), Alter Me I was played for the first time since 2024-05-18 (64 shows), and Altered Beast II was played for the first time since 2024-03-14 (72 shows). Raw Feel contained Am I In Heaven? and Head On/Pill teases. Boogieman Sam featured a guitar/harmonica duel between Joey & Amby and contained teases of Sad Pilot & The Bitter Boogie, a Mirage City jam, Altered Beast II teases and Phantom Island quotes. Chang'e was unfinished. After Hell, Joey introduced the rest of the band, followed by Stu introducing Joey. The audience then chanted "free free Palestine!"; the band encouraged them to "say that shit louder!".
data.soundcheck: Altered Beast Suite, Venusian 1, Predator X, Mirage City

data.shownotes: The Wheel was last played on 2024-05-29 (61 shows). Most Of What I Like was last played on 2024-05-31 (59 show gap). God Is Calling Me Back Home contained Green River (Creedence Clearwater Revival) and Le Risque teases. Le Risque was performed without the typical break between Cavs' and Ambrose's verses. Hog Calling Contest featured sound tech Joe Santarpia, whose birthday it was, doing pig noises. Most Of What I Like contained a Praise You (Fatboy Slim) jam. The Wheel contained Magma teases in the intro. Plastic Boogie contained a Happy Birthday To You tease. Following the song, the band thanked the crowd, everyone who followed them on tour, opening band King Stingray (who were invited onto stage), the crew, and Jason Galea. Hot Wax was introduced as a song by Jason Galea. Venusian 2 contained Hot Wax teases. Following Motor Spirit the band shouted out Allen and Jackson from the stream crew. Rattlesnake contained teases of Billabong Valley and Cellophane. At the end of the show, Ambrose quoted Nookie (Limp Bizkit).

This show was played with The Orchestra of St. Luke’s conducted by Sarah Hicks. After Spacesick, Stu thanked The Orchestra of St. Luke’s and Sarah Hicks. Aerodynamic had a lyric changed to reference New York. After Sea of Doubt, Joey mentioned a wall of alumni backstage featuring acts who have previously performed at the venue, including the Beatles, Bob Dylan, Jimi Hendrix, and the Monkees, and the band expressed their desire to be added. During Grow Wings and Fly, Stu thanked The Orchestra of St. Luke’s and Sarah Hicks again. Magma, which didn't include the "rumble" section, contained Am I In Heaven?, The Dripping Tap, and Crumbling Castle teases and ended with a The River outro which contained Sad Pilot, Crumbling Castle, and Evil Death Roll teases. Only parts I, II, and IV of The River were performed. This Thing was introduced by Joey as a song about a personal secret, and included an Incredible (M-Beat) quote. Mars for the Rich was introduced as a song about Elon Musk, and included a lyric change to "you ain't coming here, the Tesla's too dear". After Mars for the Rich, the band noted that the two shows at this venue are the only two on this tour being livestreamed, wished someone a happy birthday, and exclaimed, "free Palestine motherfuckers!" After Iron Lung, the band thanked The Orchestra of St. Luke’s and Sarah Hicks one last time, as well as thanking the audience.

Gilgamesh was labeled "Frankenstein" on the printed setlist. Only a small portion of Superposition without lyrics was played. Cyboogie was last played 2020-02-21 (240 show gap). During the jam out of The Garden Goblin, Amby asked the crowd if they wanted a drum solo, to which the crowd responded yes, and heavily drum-based improv followed. Only Ambrose's verses in Smoke & Mirrors, which contained all of The Grim Reaper rapped over it as well as Bonkers (Dizzee Rascal) quotes, were performed. Magma was played electronic for the first time and contained a Smoke & Mirrors intro, an After Midnight (J.J. Cale) quote, and Smoke & Mirrors teases and quotes. At the end of the show, Amby chanted Bullant and shouted out Jason Galea.

This show featured the live debut of Fishing For Fishies. Ice V had Muddy Water, Blindness (The Fall) and Extinction teases, as well as Joey playing riffs from various Set jams on guitar. A cake decorated to look like the Flight b741 album cover was brought on stage during Dreams. The Grim Reaper had a lyric change to "the grim reaper shits on your chest" and had quotes from Torture Chamber, Sabotage (Beastie Boys), Bonkers (Dizzee Rascal) and Rollin' (Limp Bizkit). During the song Ambrose pushed his face into the cake. Cavs went crowd surfing during Fishing For Fishies. Ambrose introduced Smoke & Mirrors as a song about someone who "did us dirty" and thanked the audience for the cake. Ambrose went crowd surfing during the song. Magma, which didn't include the "rumble" section, contained a Smoke & Mirrors jam with lyrics.

During Swan Song, the band's electronics cut out repeatedly leading Joey to call for a drum solo, which Cavs duly provided while the band troubleshooted. Extinction contained Blue Morpho quotes toward the end. During Blue Morpho, the band's electronics crashed again and the song was abandoned. During the pause the crowd called for a drum solo, which Cavs returned to the stage to provide once more and which contained Dragon teases. The subsequent "...Maddy Jam..." included opener Maddie Ashman on cello; early within the jam, Stu said, "if you like this, it means you're avant-garde". Set contained Gila Monster and Extinction quotes. Ambrose performed the verses of Smoke & Mirrors out of order, included all the lyrics from The Grim Reaper as well as Torture Chamber quotes, and changed the lyrics to "another little man trying to live the dream" as well as "Grim Reaper shits on your chest".

Due to the technical issues plaguing the first half of the show, the setlist was changed considerably from what was on the printed setlists, which read: Swan Song, Candles, Extinction, Blue Morpho, Maddy Jam, No Body, Slow Jam I, Magma, Smoke and Mirrors, Set.

Joey said "Fuck Peter Dutton" during the intro of Pleura. Before Magma Joey shouted "Light 'em up, T!" then said that he's always wanted to say that in Australia. Field of Vision contained a quote of Wipeout (The Surfaris).  Dirt was played for the first time since 2024-11-16 (50 show gap) and was played all electric for the first time. During The Dripping Tap, which contained Magma, Machine Gun (Jimi Hendrix) and Cellophane teases, Stu’s amp broke so Joey told a story while another amp was brought out. After Witchcraft, Cavs performed a drum solo while the rest of the band took a break, followed by Cavs taking his own break. The Mind Fuzz suite was introduced as a song by Jimi Hendrix called I'm In Your Mind Fuzz.  I'm Not In Your Mind contained Trapdoor, Machine Gun (Jimi Hendrix) and The Dripping Tap teases.
